wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the campus-connect project. Explain its purpose as a college event and club management system, highlighting key features such as event registration, club creation, role-based access control, and admin oversight. Describe the target user personas: students, club administrators, and college administrators. Provide a high-level architectural overview including the React frontend, Supabase backend integration, authentication flow, and data model relationships. Illustrate the application workflow from user sign-up to dashboard interaction. Include deployment context and development setup prerequisites. Make the content accessible to beginners while providing technical context for experienced developers.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layout Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the layout components in campus-connect. Focus on DashboardLayout.tsx as the central structural component that orchestrates navigation, role-based access control, and consistent UI presentation across pages. Explain how it integrates with App.tsx to wrap authenticated routes and provide shared UI elements such as sidebar, navbar, and footer. Document the responsive design patterns using use-mobile.tsx and how layout adapts across device sizes. Illustrate how layout components manage state for collapsible menus and integrate with Supabase authentication to conditionally render navigation items. Include performance considerations such as code splitting and hydration timing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication Context
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the authentication context implementation in campus-connect. Thoroughly explain how the AuthContext is created using React Context API and provided via AuthProvider to wrap the application. Document the state variables (user, session, profile, loading) and their lifecycle management through Supabase auth listeners. Detail the signIn, signUp, and signOut methods, including integration with Supabase auth flows, error handling, and toast notifications. Explain how user profile data is fetched from the 'profiles' table upon authentication and stored in context. Include examples of how components consume useAuth to conditionally render UI based on authentication state and role. Address common issues such as race conditions during session restoration, handling unverified users, and protecting routes. Provide best practices for using the hook safely, including the custom error for improper usage outside the provider. Discuss performance considerations like deferred profile fetching using setTimeout to avoid blocking the main thread.

wiki_catalogs.name: Supabase Client Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Supabase client configuration in campus-connect. Detail the initialization of the Supabase client with environment variables (SUPABASE_URL and SUPABASE_ANON_KEY), explain the singleton pattern used to instantiate the client, and describe how it is reused across components and hooks. Document the integration with React Query for data fetching, including query keys and cache management. Provide examples of authentication calls (signIn, signOut), real-time subscriptions via .on('INSERT', ...) patterns, and CRUD operations for events and clubs. Explain how row-level security policies are enforced on the client side and how session management is handled. Include troubleshooting guidance for common issues like authentication errors, network timeouts, and permission denied responses, along with performance tips such as query optimization and subscription cleanup.

wiki_catalogs.name: Authentication System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Authentication System feature. Explain the implementation of sign-in, sign-up, and role-based redirection using Supabase authentication. Document the integration between Auth.tsx and the useAuth hook, including session management and profile retrieval. Describe the user workflows for new users and returning users, including email confirmation and error handling. Include code examples showing form validation, Supabase auth calls, and loading states. Explain how authentication state is propagated through the application via context and used to control access to protected routes. Address common issues such as session persistence, password reset flows, and social login considerations. Highlight security practices like secure token storage and input sanitization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Form Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the form components in campus-connect, including form, input, textarea, checkbox, radio group, select, label, switch, toggle, and input-otp. Explain how these components are built on ShadCN UI primitives and integrated with React Hook Form via the form.tsx abstraction. Document component props, validation patterns, error handling, and accessibility attributes (ARIA labels, focus management). Provide real-world usage examples from Auth.tsx and CreateEventDialog.tsx, showing form composition for user registration and event creation. Detail styling through Tailwind CSS and utility functions from utils.ts. Address responsive behavior, mobile input considerations, and performance when handling large forms with dynamic fields.

wiki_catalogs.name: Event Management Dialogs
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the event management dialog components in campus-connect: CreateEventDialog, EventDetailsDialog, and TeamCreationDialog. Explain the purpose and user interaction flow of each dialog, including how they are triggered from the Events page and integrated within the DashboardLayout. Document the implementation of form handling using React Hook Form and validation logic (with Zod if applicable), including field requirements, error states, and submission handling. Detail how these components interact with Supabase via @tanstack/react-query mutations for creating events, fetching event details, and managing team registrations. Include code examples showing prop interfaces, event handlers, and integration with useAuth for role-based access control. Address UI/UX considerations such as loading states, success feedback via toast notifications (sonner), and accessibility features like keyboard navigation and ARIA labels. Illustrate data flow from user input to Supabase persistence and cache invalidation strategies. Cover edge cases including permission errors, network failures, and validation rejection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Event Listing
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Event Listing feature. Explain how events are fetched from Supabase using React Query, filtered, and displayed in a responsive grid or list layout. Document the integration between Events.tsx and the Supabase client, including query structure, error handling, and loading states. Describe the role of EventDetailsDialog in showing detailed event information upon user interaction. Include examples of how event data (title, date, location, club, capacity) is rendered and how users can interact with event cards. Cover filtering and search functionality if present, and explain how real-time updates are handled. Address performance considerations such as pagination, infinite scrolling, or caching strategies. Provide troubleshooting tips for common issues like failed data loading or stale event displays.

wiki_catalogs.name: Club Creation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Club Creation feature. Explain the UI and workflow of CreateClubDialog, including form fields (name, description, category), validation rules, and submission handling. Document how the form integrates with Supabase to insert a new club record with 'pending' status. Describe the role-based access control that restricts creation to authenticated users. Include code examples showing form state management and error handling. Explain the database schema for clubs, particularly the 'status' field and uniqueness constraints on club names. Address common issues such as duplicate submissions, network errors, and moderation delays. Provide guidance on potential enhancements like image uploads, club categories, or draft saving.

wiki_catalogs.name: Technology Stack & Dependencies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on the technology stack used in campus-connect. Detail the core frameworks: React with TypeScript for UI and state management, Vite as the build tool, Tailwind CSS for utility-first styling, and ShadCN UI for component primitives. Explain the role of Supabase for authentication and database operations, @tanstack/react-query for data fetching and caching, and React Router for navigation. Document key development dependencies including ESLint, PostCSS, and TypeScript configurations. Provide version compatibility notes, rationale for technology choices, and integration patterns between frontend and backend services. Include practical examples of configuration usage from vite.config.ts and tailwind.config.ts.

wiki_catalogs.name: UI Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for the reusable UI components in campus-connect, which are built using ShadCN UI primitives and extended with project-specific logic. Describe how components like button, dialog, form, table, card, and toast provide consistent styling via Tailwind CSS and utility functions from utils.ts. Explain composition patterns used to build complex interfaces from atomic components. Document accessibility features, keyboard navigation support, and ARIA attributes implemented across components. Detail the toast notification system including use-toast.ts hook and toaster integration. Provide usage examples from actual pages such as event registration and club creation. Address customization options, theme integration, and performance implications of rendering large lists with virtualization candidates.

wiki_catalogs.name: Mobile Detection
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the use-mobile hook in campus-connect. Explain how this custom hook leverages window.matchMedia to detect screen size changes and determine if the current device is mobile. Document the implementation using useState and useEffect to subscribe to media query changes and return a boolean value indicating mobile state. Describe how this hook enables responsive UI behavior across components such as Drawer vs Dialog usage, sidebar collapse, and navigation patterns. Include practical examples from the codebase showing how components conditionally render different UI elements based on the mobile state. Address edge cases such as server-side rendering where window is undefined, and how the hook handles initialization safely. Provide guidance on extending the hook for more granular breakpoint detection if needed. Highlight performance optimizations like cleanup of event listeners and efficient re-renders.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema & TypeScript Definitions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Supabase database schema types used in campus-connect. Detail the TypeScript interfaces defined in types.ts, including Profile, Event, Club, Registration, and Team entities. Explain field definitions, data types, relationships (e.g., event.creator_id â†’ profile.id), and constraints such as primary keys, foreign keys, and uniqueness rules. Document how these types ensure type safety when interacting with Supabase queries and mutations. Include examples of how these types are consumed in React components and hooks to validate fetched data. Illustrate data access patterns such as filtering events by club_id or querying user roles from the profile table. Address data validation rules, business logic enforced through types, and alignment with Supabase migration SQL files. Provide guidance on extending types for future features and maintaining synchronization between database schema and TypeScript definitions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Events Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Events Management feature. Thoroughly explain event listing, creation, registration (individual and team), and details viewing functionality. Document the implementation of CreateEventDialog and TeamCreationDialog, including form structure, validation, and submission flow to Supabase. Describe the data model relationships between events, users, registrations, and teams. Include usage examples from Events.tsx showing how events are fetched and displayed. Explain business rules such as registration deadlines, capacity limits, and club ownership requirements for event creation. Address edge cases like full events, duplicate registrations, and team size validation. Provide guidance on extending the system with features like waitlists or recurring events.

wiki_catalogs.name: Overlay Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for overlay components including dialog, sheet, popover, alert-dialog, command, dropdown-menu, context-menu, and hover-card. Explain their role in managing modal and non-modal user interactions across the application, such as event creation (CreateEventDialog), role assignment (UserRoleDialog), and navigation actions. Document trigger mechanisms, animation patterns, portal rendering, and focus trapping for accessibility. Describe how these components use Radix UI primitives and are styled consistently via Tailwind CSS. Include usage examples from Events and Admin modules, detailing composition with forms and tables. Address z-index management, keyboard navigation, and mobile responsiveness (e.g., sheets replacing dialogs on small screens).

wiki_catalogs.name: Club Management Dialogs
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the club management dialog components: CreateClubDialog and JoinRequestsDialog. Explain how CreateClubDialog enables users to submit new club proposals with name, description, and category, and how submissions are persisted to the Supabase database via react-query mutations, including draft state handling and success feedback. Describe how JoinRequestsDialog allows club administrators to review and approve membership requests, including fetching pending requests, updating status, and emitting real-time updates. Document form validation patterns, error handling, and integration with the authentication context to determine user roles and permissions. Provide concrete code examples showing component props, event callbacks, and interactions with Supabase client. Address UI behavior such as modal dismissal, loading indicators, and toast notifications upon action completion. Discuss accessibility compliance, responsive design considerations, and edge cases like rejected submissions or expired requests.

wiki_catalogs.name: Event Creation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Event Creation feature. Thoroughly explain the implementation of CreateEventDialog, including form layout, input validation, and submission flow to Supabase. Document the required fields (title, description, date, location, capacity, etc.) and their validation rules. Describe how role-based access control ensures only authorized club administrators can create events. Explain the integration with Supabase client for inserting new event records and handling success/error responses. Include code examples showing form state management and error display. Address business rules such as mandatory club ownership, future date enforcement, and capacity constraints. Provide guidance on extending the form with features like image uploads or recurring event options. Include troubleshooting tips for common issues like failed submissions or unauthorized access errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Membership Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Membership Management feature. Explain how users request to join clubs and how club administrators review and approve join requests via JoinRequestsDialog. Document the UI components, state management, and real-time data synchronization using React Query. Describe the relationship between users, clubs, and membership roles in the database schema. Include examples of how approvals update the memberships table and trigger UI updates. Explain access control rules that limit join request actions based on user role and club membership. Address edge cases such as duplicate requests, rejected applications, and leaving clubs. Discuss performance considerations for handling large numbers of requests and potential improvements like bulk actions or role assignments.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for this section focused on setting up the campus-connect development environment. Provide step-by-step instructions for cloning the repository, installing dependencies with npm or yarn, and configuring environment variables for Supabase integration. Include detailed guidance on setting up a local Supabase instance, applying migrations from the supabase/migrations directory, and seeding initial data. Document the development server startup process, hot-reload capabilities, and browser access. Add troubleshooting tips for common setup issues such as missing environment variables, database connection errors, and authentication misconfigurations. Ensure the guide is beginner-friendly with clear commands and expected output examples.

wiki_catalogs.name: Feature Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the feature-specific components in campus-connect. These dialog-driven components encapsulate core functionality such as creating events, managing team registrations, handling club membership requests, and administering user roles. Explain how each dialog component is triggered from parent pages (Events.tsx, Clubs.tsx, Admin.tsx) and interacts with Supabase via react-query mutations. Document form validation patterns using React Hook Form and Zod (if applicable), error handling, and success state management. Illustrate data flow from UI input through Supabase client to database persistence. Include real code examples showing prop interfaces, event handlers, and integration with authentication context. Address accessibility concerns, loading states, and edge cases such as network failures or permission denials.

wiki_catalogs.name: Toast Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the toast notification system in campus-connect. Explain how the use-toast hook integrates with the Sonner library to provide a declarative API for displaying toast notifications across the application. Document the structure of toast options (title, description, variant, duration) and how they are passed from components like useAuth during sign-in/sign-up flows. Detail the implementation of the Toaster and Toast components that render the notifications with proper styling and animations. Show how the hook abstracts away low-level Sonner API calls while maintaining flexibility for customization. Include real code examples from authentication flows where toast notifications provide user feedback for success and error states. Address accessibility considerations such as ARIA live regions, keyboard navigation, and auto-dismiss behavior. Discuss best practices for using toasts effectively without overwhelming users, including appropriate use of variants (default, destructive, success). Explain how the system handles stacking, positioning, and theming consistency with the rest of the ShadCN UI components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Clubs Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Clubs Management feature. Explain the club listing interface, club creation workflow (including pending approval state), and join request handling. Document the implementation of CreateClubDialog and JoinRequestsDialog, focusing on form inputs, submission logic, and real-time updates. Describe the club lifecycle from creation to approval and active status. Explain the relationship between clubs, members, and club administrators. Include examples of how user roles affect club management capabilities. Address business rules such as unique club names, approval workflows, and membership limits. Discuss potential enhancements like club categories, leadership roles, or activity tracking.

wiki_catalogs.name: Navigation Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for navigation components such as navigation-menu, tabs, breadcrumb, sidebar, menubar, and pagination. Explain how these elements structure user navigation within the DashboardLayout and across feature modules like Events, Clubs, and Admin. Document integration with React Router for active state management and URL-driven navigation. Highlight the role of sidebar and menubar in role-based access, showing different menu items for students, club admins, and college admins. Provide examples from DashboardLayout.tsx and Admin.tsx. Discuss responsive design considerations, including mobile collapse behavior and touch-friendly targets. Address accessibility via ARIA roles, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin Panel Dialogs
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the UserRoleDialog component used in the Admin panel. Explain its purpose in enabling college administrators to modify user roles (e.g., student, club admin, super admin) through a modal interface. Detail how the dialog is triggered from the Admin page, receives user data via props, and performs role updates using Supabase RPC calls or direct table mutations. Document the integration with react-query for data fetching and mutation, including cache invalidation after role changes. Illustrate how the component enforces permission checks using the useAuth hook to prevent unauthorized access. Include examples of prop interfaces, event handling logic, and error recovery mechanisms. Cover UI aspects such as role selection dropdowns, confirmation steps, and toast feedback upon successful updates. Address security considerations, audit logging implications, and edge cases like concurrent role edits or network interruptions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Event Registration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Event Registration feature. Explain how users register for events individually or as part of a team, including the UI flow from event listing to registration confirmation. Document the implementation of registration logic in Events.tsx and EventDetailsDialog, including button states (registered, full, closed). Describe the data model relationships between users, events, and registration records in Supabase. Cover business rules such as registration deadlines, capacity limits, duplicate prevention, and role-based eligibility. Include examples of how registration status is displayed and updated in real time. Address edge cases like full events, late registrations, and cancellation policies. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common issues such as failed registrations or inconsistent state displays. Suggest possible enhancements like waitlists or registration approvals.

wiki_catalogs.name: Approval Workflow
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Club Approval Workflow. Explain how newly created clubs enter a 'pending' state and require college administrator approval before becoming active. Document the Admin.tsx interface that lists pending clubs and enables approve/reject actions. Describe the Supabase backend logic that updates club status and notifies creators. Include the database schema changes across migrations that support club moderation. Explain security considerations ensuring only authorized admins can modify club status. Provide examples of audit logging, notification integration, and error handling during approval. Discuss scalability aspects for high-volume club creation and potential extensions like automated approval rules or department-based routing.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create architectural documentation for the component architecture of campus-connect. Describe the component-based design using React with a clear separation between layout components, feature components, and reusable UI primitives. Explain the role of DashboardLayout.tsx in providing consistent navigation and role-based access. Detail the organization of UI components from ShadCN and how they are extended or composed for application-specific needs. Document the component hierarchy starting from App.tsx, through routing, to page-level and dialog components. Illustrate composition patterns, prop drilling avoidance strategies, and styling integration with Tailwind. Include performance considerations such as lazy loading and component memoization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Admin Panel
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Admin Panel feature. Explain the functionality available to college administrators, including user role management and club approval. Document the implementation of UserRoleDialog for modifying user permissions and its integration with Supabase. Describe how the Admin page displays pending club requests and enables approval/rejection actions. Explain the role-based access control system that restricts this page to users with admin privileges. Include examples of audit logging considerations and data display patterns for administrative overviews. Address security implications of role changes and safeguards against privilege escalation. Provide guidance on extending the panel with additional administrative features like analytics or system notifications.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Display Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for data display components including table, card, accordion, chart, avatar, badge, progress, and skeleton. Explain how these components render structured data from Supabase across pages like Events.tsx, Clubs.tsx, and Admin.tsx. Document table column configuration, sorting, and integration with React Query for async data loading. Describe card layouts used in event and club listings, including image handling and metadata display. Detail chart usage for dashboard statistics, powered by client-side data aggregation. Address loading states using skeleton components and performance optimization for large datasets. Include accessibility considerations such as semantic HTML and screen reader announcements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Team Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the Team Management feature. Explain the implementation of TeamCreationDialog for creating and managing teams for team-based events. Document the form structure, team size validation, member selection process, and submission flow to Supabase. Describe how team data is stored and linked to events and users in the database schema. Include usage examples from Events.tsx showing how team registration is triggered and displayed. Cover business rules such as minimum/maximum team size, member uniqueness, and captain designation. Address edge cases like partial team submissions, member removal, and team dissolution. Provide troubleshooting tips for common issues like validation failures or duplicate member entries. Suggest possible extensions such as team editing after submission or team chat integration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Routing & Navigation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the routing and navigation system in campus-connect. Explain how React Router is implemented in App.tsx to manage page-level routing between Index, Auth, Events, Clubs, and Admin views. Describe the navigation structure within DashboardLayout.tsx, including role-based menu visibility and protected routes. Document the routing logic for authentication redirection and error handling via NotFound.tsx. Provide code examples showing route definitions, navigation links, and dynamic route parameters. Address accessibility considerations in navigation menus and mobile responsiveness. Include guidance on adding new routes and integrating them with the existing navigation system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Feedback Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for feedback components including toast, toaster, use-toast, alert, and sonner. Explain the toast notification system architecture, from hook invocation (use-toast) to rendering (toaster) with support for success, error, and info variants. Document how these components provide real-time feedback for actions like event registration, club creation, and role updates. Describe integration with React Query for mutation feedback and error handling from Supabase calls. Provide examples from CreateClubDialog and JoinRequestsDialog. Address theming consistency with Tailwind, stacking behavior, auto-dismiss timers, and user interaction (manual dismissal). Include accessibility features such as live regions and focus management.

wiki_catalogs.name: State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the state management system in campus-connect. Focus on the custom hooks implementation: useAuth for authentication state and user profile management, use-mobile for responsive layout detection, and use-toast for notification handling. Explain how React Context API is used to provide global state access across components. Detail the authentication flow including sign-in, sign-up, session persistence, and role-based state updates. Document the integration between useAuth and Supabase client, including error handling and loading states. Provide examples of how components consume these hooks and best practices for state management in React components.

wiki_catalogs.name: Layout & Utility Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for layout and utility components such as resizable, scroll-area, aspect-ratio, separator, collapsible, and the utility functions in utils.ts. Explain how these components support responsive and adaptive layouts across different screen sizes and device types. Document the use of utils.ts for className merging (cn function) and its critical role in component composition. Describe scroll-area usage in dashboards with long content, aspect-ratio in media display, and separator for visual grouping. Highlight resizable and collapsible in advanced UIs like admin panels or data-heavy views. Provide examples from DashboardLayout and event detail views. Address performance implications and accessibility (e.g., scroll keyboard controls).

wiki_catalogs.name: API Integration Layer
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for the Supabase integration layer in campus-connect. Document the client.ts configuration including Supabase URL and public key initialization, client instantiation pattern, and singleton usage across the application. Explain the types.ts file and how it defines TypeScript interfaces for database entities (Profile, Event, Club, Registration, Team). Detail the data access patterns including authentication methods, real-time subscriptions, and CRUD operations for events and clubs. Include examples of querying data with React Query, handling relationships between tables, and managing row-level security policies. Address error handling, rate limiting considerations, and debugging strategies for Supabase API calls.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Features
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the core features of campus-connect. Provide an overview of the four main feature areas: Authentication System, Events Management, Clubs Management, and Admin Panel. For each feature, explain its purpose, user workflows, and integration with other system components. Describe the implementation of authentication flows, event creation and registration (including team events), club lifecycle management, and administrative controls. Document the relationship between pages, dialogs, and underlying data models. Include practical usage examples and screenshots where applicable. Address business rules and validation logic implemented in each feature area.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive data model documentation for the Supabase database schema used in campus-connect. Detail the entity relationships between Profile, Event, Club, Registration, and Team tables. Explain field definitions, data types, primary/foreign keys, and constraints derived from types.ts and migration files. Document the role-based access control implementation in the schema, including user roles (student, club_admin, admin) and their permissions. Include schema evolution history from the migration files and upgrade procedures. Provide database schema diagrams, sample queries, and indexing strategies. Address data validation rules, referential integrity, and performance considerations for common access patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Styling Strategy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the styling strategy in campus-connect. Explain the utility-first approach using Tailwind CSS and how it's configured in tailwind.config.ts with custom themes and breakpoints. Describe the integration of ShadCN UI components and how their base styles are extended or overridden in App.css. Document the responsive design implementation, including mobile-first principles and use of use-mobile.tsx hook. Provide guidelines for adding new styles, creating consistent UI patterns, and maintaining design system coherence. Include examples of common styling tasks such as creating forms, cards, and data tables using the existing component library.

wiki_catalogs.name: Build & Deployment
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for building and deploying the campus-connect application. Document the build process using Vite, including environment variable handling, asset optimization, and output generation. Explain deployment options for the frontend (e.g., Vercel, Netlify) and backend (Supabase). Provide configuration details from vite.config.ts and supabase/config.toml relevant to deployment. Include instructions for setting up continuous integration, running migrations in production, and managing environment-specific configurations. Address performance optimization techniques such as code splitting, image optimization, and caching strategies. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common deployment issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Developer Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for developers contributing to campus-connect. Cover codebase conventions including TypeScript typing patterns, component structure, and file organization. Document the linting and formatting rules enforced by ESLint and how to set up the development environment with proper editor configurations. Explain the component generation process using components.json for ShadCN UI. Provide guidelines for creating new pages, components, and hooks while maintaining consistency with existing patterns. Include testing recommendations, debugging strategies, and performance monitoring practices. Address contribution workflows, branch management, and pull request requirements.

wiki_overview.content:
<blog>
# CampusConnect - College Event Management System

## 1. Project Introduction

### Purpose Statement
CampusConnect is a comprehensive college event management system designed to streamline campus activities, club management, and event organization. The application provides a centralized platform for students, club administrators, and college administrators to manage events, clubs, and user roles.

### Core Goals and Objectives
- Enable students to discover and register for campus events
- Provide club administrators with tools to create and manage clubs and events
- Allow college administrators to oversee user roles and approve clubs
- Facilitate team-based event registration and attendance tracking
- Create a unified platform for campus community engagement

### Target Audience
- **Students**: Primary users who can browse events, register for activities, and join clubs
- **Club Administrators**: Faculty or student leaders who manage specific clubs and their events
- **College Administrators**: Staff members who oversee the entire system, approve clubs, and manage user roles

## 2. Technical Architecture

### Component Breakdown
The application follows a modern React architecture with several key components:

- **Core Framework**: React with TypeScript for type safety
- **Routing**: React Router for client-side navigation
- **State Management**: Context API for authentication state, React Query for data fetching
- **UI Components**: ShadCN UI components with Tailwind CSS for styling
- **Backend Integration**: Supabase for authentication, database, and storage
- **Form Handling**: Custom hooks and state management for forms

### Design Patterns
The application implements several design patterns:

- **Provider Pattern**: AuthProvider wraps the application to provide authentication context
- **Component Composition**: DashboardLayout and UI components are reused across pages
- **Separation of Concerns**: Clear separation between components, hooks, pages, and integrations
- **Type Safety**: Comprehensive TypeScript interfaces for database schema and application state

### System Relationships
```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[Client] --> B[React Frontend]
  B --> C[Supabase Authentication]
  B --> D[Supabase Database]
  C --> E[(PostgreSQL Database)]
  D --> E
  B --> F[Tailwind CSS]
  B --> G[React Query]
  H[User] --> B
```

### Data Flow
```mermaid
flowchart TD
  A[User Interaction] --> B[React Component]
  B --> C[useAuth Hook]
  C --> D[Supabase Client]
  D --> E[Supabase Auth API]
  D --> F[Supabase Database API]
  E --> G[(Authentication Data)]
  F --> H[(Application Data)]
  G --> C
  H --> C
  C --> B
  B --> I[UI Update]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- [main.tsx](src/main.tsx): Application entry point that renders the App component
- [App.tsx](src/App.tsx): Root component that sets up routing and global providers

### Core Modules
- [useAuth.tsx](src/hooks/useAuth.tsx): Authentication context and user profile management
- [client.ts](src/integrations/supabase/client.ts): Supabase client configuration
- [types.ts](src/integrations/supabase/types.ts): Database schema types

### Configuration Approach
- [vite.config.ts](vite.config.ts): Vite build configuration
- [tailwind.config.ts](tailwind.config.ts): Tailwind CSS configuration
- [tsconfig.json](tsconfig.json): TypeScript configuration
- [package.json](package.json): Dependency management

### External Dependencies
- [package.json](package.json): Lists all external dependencies including React, React Router, Supabase, and UI libraries

### Integration Points
- [client.ts](src/integrations/supabase/client.ts): Supabase integration for authentication and database access
- [types.ts](src/integrations/supabase/types.ts): Type definitions for database schema

### Component Relationships
```mermaid
graph LR
  App[App Component] --> AuthProvider[AuthProvider]
  App --> QueryClientProvider[QueryClientProvider]
  App --> Router[BrowserRouter]
  Router --> Index[Index Page]
  Router --> Auth[Auth Page]
  Router --> Events[Events Page]
  Router --> Clubs[Clubs Page]
  Router --> Admin[Admin Page]
  AuthProvider --> useAuth[useAuth Hook]
  useAuth --> supabase[Supabase Client]
  Index --> DashboardLayout[DashboardLayout]
  Index --> Card[UI Card Components]
  Auth --> Tabs[UI Tabs Component]
  Auth --> Form[UI Form Components]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
CampusConnect offers several key features:

- **User Authentication**: Sign in and sign up with role-based access
- **Event Management**: Create, view, and register for events
- **Club Management**: Create clubs, manage memberships, and handle join requests
- **Team Registration**: Register for team-based events with team creation
- **Dashboard Analytics**: View statistics on events, students, and clubs
- **Role-Based Access**: Different interfaces for students, club admins, and college admins

### Implementation Highlights
- **Authentication Flow**: Implemented with Supabase auth and custom React hooks
- **Role-Based Routing**: Different pages accessible based on user role
- **Real-time Data**: Supabase integration for real-time database updates
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first approach with responsive layouts
- **Form Validation**: Client-side validation for all forms

### Feature Architecture
```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  [*] --> Unauthenticated
  Unauthenticated --> AuthPage: Visit site
  AuthPage --> SignIn: User chooses sign in
  AuthPage --> SignUp: User chooses sign up
  SignIn --> Authenticated: Successful login
  SignUp --> EmailConfirmation: Account created
  EmailConfirmation --> Authenticated: Email confirmed
  Authenticated --> Dashboard: Role-based redirect
  Dashboard --> Events: Navigate to events
  Dashboard --> Clubs: Navigate to clubs
  Dashboard --> Admin: Admin features (if admin)
  Events --> Register: Register for event
  Register --> TeamCreation: If team event
  TeamCreation --> RegistrationConfirmed: Team created
  RegistrationConfirmed --> Dashboard: Return to dashboard
```

### Database Schema Overview
```mermaid
erDiagram
  USER ||--o{ PROFILE : has
  PROFILE ||--o{ CLUB_MEMBERS : "is member of"
  PROFILE ||--o{ REGISTRATIONS : "registers for"
  PROFILE ||--o{ TEAM_MEMBERS : "is member of"
  CLUB ||--o{ CLUB_MEMBERS : "has"
  CLUB ||--o{ EVENTS : "organizes"
  EVENTS ||--o{ REGISTRATIONS : "has"
  EVENTS ||--o{ TEAMS : "requires"
  TEAMS ||--o{ TEAM_MEMBERS : "has"
  CLUB ||--o{ JOIN_REQUESTS : "receives"
  PROFILE ||--o{ JOIN_REQUESTS : "submits"
```

Sources:
- [main.tsx](src/main.tsx#L0-L5)
- [App.tsx](src/App.tsx#L0-L38)
- [useAuth.tsx](src/hooks/useAuth.tsx#L0-L197)
- [client.ts](src/integrations/supabase/client.ts#L0-L16)
- [types.ts](src/integrations/supabase/types.ts#L0-L513)
- [Index.tsx](src/pages/Index.tsx#L0-L276)
- [Auth.tsx](src/pages/Auth.tsx#L0-L236)
</blog>
